definition: to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander/news/(coll.) to delay/to dilly-dally

sentences.english: Brazil spends trillions and can't solve the problem of the favelas.
sentences.chinese: 巴西耗资无数，仍然无法解决贫民窟的问题。

sentences.english: But progress is slow and expensive.
sentences.chinese: 但是工程进度迟缓，而且耗资巨大。

sentences.english: Total costs for the plan are estimated in the hundreds of billions of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 据估计，这项计划的全部耗资将达到数千亿美元。

sentences.english: Filling it could take 15 years and cost up to $4.5bn.
sentences.chinese: 灌满这个湖需花费15年，耗资高达45亿美元。

sentences.english: Your plan fell down when it proved too costly.
sentences.chinese: 你的计划是不切合实际的，因为它被证实耗资太大。

sentences.english: Big corporate logos that need to represent a brand can cost tens of thousands of dollars.
sentences.chinese: 大公司往往耗资数万元来设计展现自己品牌的标志。

sentences.english: Around 200 people attended the ceremony, which included a firework display estimated to have cost 40, 000 euros ($51, 000), the paper said.
sentences.chinese: 大约有200人参加的这场婚礼估计耗资4万欧元。

sentences.english: Nvidia has spent more than $300 million to address the problem.
sentences.chinese: 英伟达已耗资逾三亿美元解决这个问题。

sentences.english: Now let us look at some cost implications related to Brix.
sentences.chinese: 现在，让我们看一下关于白利度造成耗资的影响因素。

sentences.english: Such wedding ceremony must continue about approximately 30 days, wasting assets approximately thousand Egyptian pounds.
sentences.chinese: 这样的婚礼大约要持续30天左右，耗资约千余埃镑。

sentences.english: Should Medicare spend billions to pay for targeted radiation?
sentences.chinese: 医疗保险还需耗资数十亿美元来支付靶向放疗吗？

sentences.english: It's said to have been built by 4 brothers for their 84-year-old father, costing RMB1m.
sentences.chinese: 据说是当地4兄弟为84岁的父亲所建，耗资百万。

sentences.english: The total cost of building the whole college town will be 2.5 billion yuan.
sentences.chinese: 整座大学城的建成耗资25亿人民币。

sentences.english: Murkowski said the proposal covers the entire project, estimated to cost $20 billion.
sentences.chinese: 估计整个开采计划将耗资200亿美元。

sentences.english: The construction lasted several years and cost a large sum of money.
sentences.chinese: 由于工程浩大，持续了数年，耗资万金。

definition: to fund/to put money into sth/to invest
time-consuming/to take a period of (x amount of time)
over one billion/more than a billion
Gundam, Japanese animation franchise/Jean-Luc Godard (1930-), French-Swiss film director
to spare no effort/to devote all one's energies
